Question
========

Right after the vacations you hear that you have to take a true-false test with 30 questions must take. Suppose you have to pass 60% (or 18 questions) of all the questions and you haven't been able to prepare at all. What is the probability that you will give the correct answer on 60% or more of all the questions if you guess all the answers? (Students should use the table of Standard Normal Probabilities.)_____________________________.

Answerlist
----------

* 0,127
* 0,360
* 0,600
* 0,997

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.127: Correct
* 0,360: Incorrect
* 0.600: Incorrect
* 0.997: Incorrect
